Q: How many places are there to eat on campus? A: 4. The commons has a food court. The dining hall which is buffet style. Chick-fil-a and Starbucks are in the UC. And Admin has a small cafe.
 * * *
 Q: What is there to do around campus? A: The student events board, known as (seb), hosts many events during the school year. Breakfast and bingo, open mic night, and weekend movies are some of the most popular events on campus.
 * * *
 Q: How can I get involved in clubs? A: Each semester UMBC hosts Involvement Fest so you can window shop and sign up for clubs you are interested in. You can also visit the office of student life where they can help you find a club that's right for.

item.string: The University Center is located between upper and lower academic row. Many events at UMBC take place in the ballroom including concerts, orientation, and (seb) events. On the lower floor you\'ll find Starbucks and Chick-fil-a, two popular locations for students to hang out during the day.

Affectionately known as Club AOK, the UMBC library features 7 floors of books and resources. The Retriever Learning Center (RLC) on the first floor is accessible to anyone with a red student ID 24 hours a day.\n\n To learn more about the AOK library, visit https://www.umbc.edu/aok/main/index.html

The Retriever Activities Center, or "The RAC", is UMBC\'s very own gym. Features include an indoor pool, an outdoor pool, a full sized basketball court, and the newly renovated weight room. \n\n For more information on the RAC, visit umbcretrievers.com/information/facilities/racarena/index

True Grit\s Dining Hall is a buffet style, all you can eat, dining facility. With a salad bar, a vegan section, and the Kosher Korner, students will find their favorite foods at True Grit\'s!\n\n For more information on True Grit\'s, and other UMBC dining facilities, visit http://www.umbc.edu/reslife/living/dining_facilities.html
ITE is the home of the computer science department. Inside you\'ll find many lecture halls and classrooms as well as teachers offices.
